column4: perhaps mplayer can't handle sound if you're using the sound server
Sound server? does mplayer require working sound card configuration?
how can I be sure if I am using sound server and what other options do I have?
Can't mplayer work with sound server enabled?
And can gnome use sounds without sound server?
mplayer can use the server. and yes, gnome sounds work but only one at a time. the server is for playing multiple sounds simultaneously
like if you're listening to music and an alarm sound goes off
You suggested than mplayer might hang because sound server was used? What you ment with that?
mplayer hangs because the it tries to use the sound device, but the device is busy because the server is using it. so, mplayer should use the server, not talk to devices directly
what's with mplayer anyway? you said totem works. anyway, it's an mplayer configuration option, tell it to use "esd"
Totem is fine, but Im going to use the vdr mplayer plugin and I think that mplayer should work before I try that.
ok. does mplayer hang immediately or can you get to the GUI?
It opens but hung when tried to open file. Now I changed sound to esd but now it firt says about interrupt 11: decode_audio and then crashed to fatal error.
hrmpf. then i don't know, sorry. i don't use mplayer :)
I also tried null audio but it still complains about interrupt 11: decode_audio
